frame.name: Continued_state_of_affairs
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> has held and continues to hold up to the <fen>Reference_occasion</fen>.
<ex><fex name="ref"><t>To date</t></fex>, <fex name="soa">the Department already has numerous requests for new systems to be developed</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="soa">SAGE has no activities planned</fex> <fex name="ref"><t>as of yet</t></fex>.</ex>
<ex>PBGC guarantees the benefit <fex name="soa">that you had earned</fex> <t>up to</t> <fex name="ref">the date of plan termination</fex></ex>
<ex>I think that <fex name="soa">she 's</fex> <t><fex name="ref">still</fex></t> <fex name="soa">in her office</fex> .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: State_of_affairs
FE.definition:
<def-root>A state which holds prior to and up through the <fen>Reference_occasion</fen>.
<ex><fex name="soa">How is your course going</fex> <t>so far</t>?</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Reference_occasion
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time or event (normally speech time) with respect to which the <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> is located.
<ex>She was loving and concerned about others <t>up to</t> <fex name="ref">her dying breath</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. </def-root>
